channel.title: Rsc for linux
channel.description:
Hey. I am attempting to get RSC to work on linux. What kind of process would i need to go through?
I tried changing the .bat files into .sh ... it wont execute. i installed jdk. but i cant get anything to execute.
where would i start?

item.title: Rsc for linux
item.dc:creator: @xx_c1ph3r_xx xx c1ph3r xx
item.description:
@xx_c1ph3r_xx wrote:

[quote=“snoopy89, post:21, topic:306140”][quote author=yong min link=topic=402322.msg2994830#msg2994830 date=1255516792]

Great! Thanks a lot! I am using Noobscape… i think its 2.5

Don’t think noobscape works on linux.

NOOBscape is based off EasyRSC. If he follows the tutorial provided, he’ll get NOOBscape working on linux.
[/quote][quote author=xx c1ph3r xx link=topic=402322.msg2994977#msg2994977 date=1255529996]
uhm snoopy-1
yong min+1
[/quote]

Gtfo! I said I ‘‘think’’ Because i heard someone saying it doesn’t work because of the gui.

1- for you big fella![/quote]

Like I said, you flame every chance you get son.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc for linux
item.dc:creator: @deftz deftz
item.description:
@deftz wrote:

i have 3 computers.
one is linux.
one is win7
one is vista
lol
im trying to get it to work on either the win7 or linux…
i can get it to work on vista… but i cant get the firewall to work on win7. and i cant get the program to execute correctly on linux…

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc for linux
item.dc:creator: @lol_k lol k
item.description:

no point in trying to run a server on linux you will run into a million problems.[/quote]

what do u mean by this?, like u can download, say vista and i will have vista?, even if i have xp?, jwing since i dont understand

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc for linux
item.dc:creator: @deftz deftz
item.description:
@deftz wrote:

ok. well im attempting to get linux to run. so far ive been told to change all the ; to : … and to convert .bat to .sh …

what else do i need to do to get it to run? do i have to do anything with the java variables like in windows? what other problems are there?

obviously this has been done many times before…

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc for linux
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Iron Maiden, post:7, topic:306140”]go download windows xp or windows 7

no point in trying to run a server on linux you will run into a million problems.[/quote]
Not true. It will run perfectly fine on linux, providing you know how to operate the system properly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @deftz deftz
item.description:
@deftz wrote:

ok. well. now im trying it on a win7 box.

since you put it that way.

for whatever the reason… i can get other computers in my house to connect to my vista box… but not to my win7 box. even when i put in the port exceptions…

what do i need to do to get my vista box to connect to my win7 box? using easyrsc ?

with win7 being the server and vista - the client
